page.title: 16Landscape
page.content: The Borough of Accrington is pleasantly situated among a ring of encircling hills.Which give it shelter and at the same time help to precipitate the rainfall and also give rise to the numerous streams whice course down the hillsides and through the local cloughs. These streams however have been cut down through the deposits of glacial drift and eaten into the native rocks with the result that where sandstones overbying shales have been encountered harming waterfalls have been formed as a result of the superior durabiliting by the sandstones.This is well seen in Warmden Clough at the fall known as the great arc where a little gorge has been cut through the Great Arc Sandstone by the recesion of the waterfall face.The highest point in our block is Great Hameldon with the height of 409 metres.
